data.title: AFI Silver Theatre and Cultural Center
data.meta_description:
The final pairing of Humphrey Bogart and Lauren Bacall is a spine-tingling tale of a World War II veteran (Bogart) running up against a gangster (Edward G. Robinson) who's holding the staff and guests of a coastal hotel hostage as a hurricane bears down on them. Bacall plays the daughter of the proprietor (Lionel Barrymore), and film noir's grandest dame, Claire Trevor, is Gaye Dawn, a broken-down chanteuse who's Eddie G.'s booze-sodden moll. Trevor won the Best Supporting Actress Oscar® for her memorable performance. (Note courtesy of the Film Noir Foundation.) DIR/SCR John Huston; SCR Richard Brooks, from the play by Maxwell Anderson; PROD Jerry Wald. U.S., 1948, b&w, 101 min. NOT RATED

No AFI Member passes accepted.
data.meta_site_name: AFI Silver Theatre and Cultural Center
data.text:
KEY LARGO (1948)

The final pairing of Humphrey Bogart and Lauren Bacall is a spine-tingling tale of a World War II veteran (Bogart) running up against a gangster (Edward G. Robinson) who's holding the staff and guests of a coastal hotel hostage as a hurricane bears down on them. Bacall plays the daughter of the proprietor (Lionel Barrymore), and film noir's grandest dame, Claire Trevor, is Gaye Dawn, a broken-down chanteuse who's Eddie G.'s booze-sodden moll. Trevor won the Best Supporting Actress Oscar® for her memorable performance. (Note courtesy of the Film Noir Foundation.) DIR/SCR John Huston; SCR Richard Brooks, from the play by Maxwell Anderson; PROD Jerry Wald. U.S., 1948, b&w, 101 min. NOT RATED

No AFI Member passes accepted.
